_header: Alas Death alas a blessful thing ye were
_description: An epitaph, including a warning to ‘galaunts’, accompanying a wall-painting of a young man confronted by a skeleton — two stanzas rhyme royal

SalisbHunCh.First Lines:
Alasse, Dethe, alasse, a blesful thyng þu wereYf thow wolldyst
                    spare us yn our lustynesse…
SalisbHunCh.Last Lines:
…Beholde thaym well, consydere and seeFor such as thay ar,
                    such shalt þow be
SalisbHunCh.Editions:
Pettigrew,  Thomas Joseph. 
             Chronicles of the Tombs.
         London: Bohn, 1857, and subsequent printings: 170-1.
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 348.
Gray,  Douglas. 
             Themes and Images in the Medieval Religious Lyric.
         London: Routledge and Kegan Paul, 1972: 207.
